summary: This is the U.S. Government's memorandum in support of pretrial detention for Ghislaine Maxwell, filed in the Southern District of New York. It argues she is an extreme flight risk due to the seriousness of the charges, strong evidence against her, her substantial financial resources, multiple citizenships, and lack of meaningful ties to the United States.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts and perjury, alleged to have been a key associate of Jeffrey Epstein in grooming and abusing underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as a serial sexual predator with whom Maxwell partnered to exploit and abuse young girls. Mentioned in relation to financial transfers and the abuse scheme.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; Maxwell was one of Epstein's closest associates and partnered with him in a scheme to sexually abuse underage girls.
Between 2007 and 2011, approximately more than $20 million was transferred from accounts associated with Epstein to accounts associated with Maxwell, with millions subsequently transferred back.

events.title: Indictment Returned
events.description: A federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned a sealed indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with multiple counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Scheme
events.description: The period during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse underage girls at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico.

events.title: Civil Deposition
events.description: Maxwell gave deposition testimony in connection with a civil lawsuit in the Southern District of New York, during which she allegedly lied under oath about her role in facilitating the abuse of minors.

events.title: Property Sale
events.description: Maxwell appears to have sold a New York City residence for $15 million through an LLC, with over $14 million subsequently deposited into and transferred between her accounts.

events.title: Property Acquisition in New Hampshire
events.description: Maxwell appears to have been hiding on a 156-acre property in Bradford, New Hampshire, acquired in an all-cash purchase through an anonymized LLC.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sex acts (1994-1997) and two counts of perjury from a 2016 deposition.

The government argues Maxwell is an extreme flight risk due to her three citizenships (US, UK, France), frequent international travel, substantial and opaque financial resources, and lack of meaningful ties to the US.

Financial investigation revealed Maxwell had access to accounts holding hundreds of thousands to over $20 million, engaged in large transfers, and received over $20 million from Jeffrey Epstein's accounts between 2007-2011.

After Epstein's indictment was unsealed in July 2019, Maxwell went into hiding, moving locations, changing contact information, and was found on a recently purchased, secluded property in New Hampshire.
The victims in the case were as young as 14 years old, and multiple victims have provided detailed, credible accounts corroborated by documents, records, and other evidence.
